description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to expand access to, and ensure sustainable water supply and sanitation services in rural and small town communities in six regions of Ghana.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Standard Financial covenants as stated in the Financing Agreement Schedule 2, | Description :The Recipient shallhave its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the General Conditions. | Frequency:Yearly

title.narrative: Timely submittal of clean (unqualified) FM audit reports (percent for each participating DA)
Subproject implementation in accordance with timetable in procurement plan (percent for each participating DA)
Acceptable implementation (including safeguards) quarterly reports delivered on time (percent for each participating DA)
Percentage of installed water supply system functional
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
New water systems based on boreholes fitted with hand pumps operational
Former GWCL systems transferred to communities rehabilitated
Reliability of water supply services under the project area
Communities sensitized about hygiene practices and eradication of open free defecation
Key institutions (CWSA, MOFEP, MSWR, MMDAs) trained in the use Sector Information Systems
Improved latrines constructed under the project
New Institutional toilet facilities constructed and operational

New water systems for small towns operational (number)
New community water systems fed from GWCL
